abstract.t: This document defines a canonical identifier for workloads, referred to as the Workload Identifier. A Workload Identifier is a URI that uniquely identifies a workload within the context of a specific trust domain. This identifier can be embedded in digital credentials, including X.509 certificates and security tokens, to support authentication, authorization, and policy enforcement across diverse systems. The Workload Identifier format ensures interoperability, facilitates secure identity federation, and enables consistent identity semantics.
